tweets.text: There is a lot of water in the drains, watercourses and lagoons at the moment, but Hull City Council and our @LivingWithH2O partners @EnvAgencyYNE @YorkshireWater and @ERfloodrisk are aware and are working together around the clock to try and keep the water where it belongs! https://t.co/KjDZq6iQlY

It‚Äôs really important foul odours are reported to the Environment Agency @EnvAgencyMids so we can force them to act. This can be done by Tel: 0800 80 70 60 email: enquiries_westmids@environment-agency.gov.uk.  More news to come.. https://t.co/I8bMZFLfHf

We have teams out across #Yorkshire checking defences because of rainfall and snow melt, which are keeping river levels high. We have 5 #flood warnings and 9 flood alerts in place. Check your latest flood risk here and sign up for warnings: https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb
#Floodaware https://t.co/wORlV7VnIA

Communities across Yorkshire face a variety of different flood risks, but did you know that there are steps you can take to make your home, business or property more resilient? @YorkshireiCASP @JBAConsulting  @LivingWithH2O @EnvAgency https://t.co/dY75bYC18q

@CRTContactUs @ben_watt @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency Hi Rachael. Thank you. It‚Äôs the Brent Reservoir (Welsh Harp). CRT has lowered the water but not planned for clearing up the mounds of rubbish. Water will be raised to normal levels by 26 Feb.

@AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @EnvAgency The company in question is working well within the @EnvAgency rules & regulations; the main issue is the housing development off Keele Road, whose residents feel the odour unreasonable, despite being within the set limits. tweets.text: @DeTom48 @EnvAgencySE @SE_Rivers_Trust @SussexFlow Thanks for replying - but you are missing my point. I was just questioning the use of 'clearing rivers' in the original tweet. It reinforces a view that #rivers are simply drainage channels. I know rivers need to be managed to reduce flood risk. I appreciate the work you do.

@PeterMassini @EnvAgencySE @SE_Rivers_Trust @SussexFlow When a blockage has been cleared it is more often a result of a report from local residents who like to see the task is done, we only ever remove items that do present flood risk, if there is no risk the item is left in place.

@EnvAgencySE @DeTom48 Wouldn't it be better not to talk of 'clearing rivers' to reduce #floodrisk?That plays into the idea that rivers + ditches should be managed to maximise conveyance whereas often the answer to reducing flood risk is to #slowtheflow @SE_Rivers_Trust @SussexFlow

@ROBANDTHEMOB @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @EnvAgency That‚Äôs is complete nonsense. You just have to visit Garners. Secondly the license was granted for inert material which by definition does not rot or smell.
@DeTom48 @EnvAgencySE @SE_Rivers_Trust @SussexFlow I know. I was just suggesting more  nuance is needed - especially on a corporate #EnvironmentAgency account. Not always easy on Twitter I accept.

tweets.text: @DoddyDodds @GroundwaterMike @EnvAgency @ENDSonline Some incredibly emotive wording in that article! Are they causing a significant impact to the env of human health? urls.title: Planning progress and funding success
urls.description: It's been a busy autumn with various planning applications progressing and work starting at Ponts Mill - as well as awards and funding success documents with information about our third package of flood measures in the Luxulyan Road, Cornhill Road, R ose Hill and Doubletrees area - see planning portal reference: PA20/06955 It's been a hectic few months preparing information to support the project's various planning applications with measures across Par and St Blazey. We've also been answering questions

tweets.text: @GroundwaterMike @EnvAgency Back in the day, it could be argued that environmental regulators balanced legal regulation with management. Perhaps what Mr Bevan is describing is management? The regulators will need proper funding & a #science led approach to achieve that.
@DoddyDodds @EnvAgency How might his organisation Chair perceive this as a strategy? One for business Chairpersons to consider in detailüòú
@GroundwaterMike @EnvAgency Not sure it's a strategy, more of a wish list.

@DoddyDodds @EnvAgency Agreed. There‚Äôs not much risk assessment gone on before this @ENDSonline article was produced. Many other data sets available to assess environmental risk & wonder who, if anyone is looking at this. Guess it‚Äôs partly in the local authority domain.
